## Task 1: Sierra Amphibians

```{r}
#Read in data using here()
sierra_amphibians <- read_excel(here("sierra_amphibians.xlsx"))

#filter to show only yellow legged frogs (RAMU) and exclude EggMass lifestage
yellow_legged <- sierra_amphibians %>% 
  filter(amphibian_species == "RAMU", 
         amphibian_life_stage %in% 
           c("Adult", "SubAdult", "Tadpole")) %>%
#convert dates and make year column using lubridate package
  mutate(date_new = ymd(survey_date)) %>%
  mutate(Year = year(date_new))
#Count number of frogs in each lifecylce category per year
yellow_legged_count <- yellow_legged %>%  
group_by(Year, amphibian_life_stage) %>%
  count()


#graph counts using ggplot2
frog_year <- ggplot(data = yellow_legged_count, aes(x = Year, y = n, color = amphibian_life_stage)) + geom_line() + theme(legend.position = c(0.15, 0.8), legend.title = element_blank(), legend.background = element_rect(fill="lightblue", size=0.5, linetype="solid", colour ="black"), panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white"), panel.grid.major = element_line(size = 0.5, linetype = 'solid', colour = "grey"), panel.grid.minor = element_line(size = 0.25, linetype = 'solid', colour = "grey")) + labs(y = "Number of Frogs", title = "Figure 1")

frog_year

```

```{r}
#wrangle to keep only subadults and adults, add "Lake" into lake_id col
yellow_legged_lake <- yellow_legged %>%
  filter(amphibian_life_stage %in% c("Adult", "SubAdult")) %>% 
  mutate("Lake" = "Lake") %>% 
  unite("lake", Lake, lake_id, sep = " ")

#make a subset of the five lakes with the most frogs
top_five_lake <- yellow_legged_lake %>% 
  count(lake) %>% 
  rename(frog_count = n) %>% 
  slice_max(frog_count, n = 5)

#graph using fact_reorder() to sort columns
frog_lake <- ggplot(data = top_five_lake, aes(x= fct_reorder(lake, frog_count), y = frog_count)) + 
  geom_col(fill = "dodgerblue") + 
  labs(x = element_blank(), y = "Frog Count") + 
  coord_flip() + 
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white"), panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(), panel.grid.major.x = element_line(size = 0.5, linetype = 'solid', colour = "grey"), panel.grid.minor.x = element_line(size = 0.25, linetype = 'solid', colour = "grey")) + labs(title = "Figure 2")

frog_lake
```

```{r, fig.width=10}
#combine using patchwork
combined_graph <- (frog_year | frog_lake)
combined_graph + plot_annotation(caption = "These two figures depict yellow-legged frogs in the southern sierra nevada. Figure 1 shows the total number of yellow-legged frogs in the study per year \nand broken up by life stage. Figure 2 shows the top five lakes with the most subadult and adult yellow-legged frogs. The data was collected in the southern \nsierra nevada from 1995-2002 (Napp et al.)", theme = theme(plot.caption = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0, vjust = 0)))
```

**Data Citation** Knapp, R.A., C. Pavelka, E.E. Hegeman, and T.C. Smith. 2020.
